channel.title: Ramah: Archived Good News
channel.description: Archived positive news stories from the Ramah collection

item.title: ‘I’ve seen a lot of great pissheads’: Stephen Graham on booze, Baftas and the return of his bone-crunching boxing thriller
item.description: Stephen Graham had a stellar 2025.

item.title: Cocktail of the week: the Kirkstyle Inn’s beetroot and sumac shrub – recipe | The good mixer
item.description: Traditionally, shrubs are made with vinegar, but for this one we use lemon juice to bring a bright sharpness to the base syrup, because it balances the earthy sweetness of the beetroot and sumac.

item.title: ‘A place of darkness and light’: the uninhabited Japanese island that became a rabbit paradise
item.description: The bunny-ear designs on the window aside, there is little to indicate that the ferry has arrived on an island teeming with rabbits.

item.title: Record year for wind and solar electricity in Great Britain in 2025
item.description: Renewable energy - considered crucial to limiting climate change - produced a record amount of electricity in Great Britain in 2025, BBC analysis shows.

item.title: The perfect way to look after your health if you work shifts
item.description: The knock-on effects on systemic health are many: “We know that shift workers have a higher risk of heart disease, hypertension, obesity, diabetes, stroke, depression, anxiety and some types of cancer.” The World Health Organization has classified shift work as “probably carcinogenic”.

item.title: Sailors saved from going over edge of huge dam
item.description: Footage shows captured the moment four men were pulled to safety, after spending hours dangling off the edge of a 40m (130ft) dam in South Africa.

item.title: 'Paul was fun' - Remembering snooker's lost great 20 years on
item.description: A sporting bug, caught at the age of three with the help of a tiny snooker set on his parents' coffee table in their Leeds home, would culminate in a professional career that saw him win six major trophies in six years.

item.title: Chess: Magnus Carlsen wins two more world speed crowns despite mishaps
item.description: The world No 1, Magnus Carlsen, recovered from a series of mishaps to win both the World Rapid and Blitz crowns at Doha, Qatar, last weekend.

item.title: Blank Canvas by Grace Murray review – a superb debut from a 22-year-old author
item.description: Lies offend our sense of justice: generally, we want to see the liar unmasked and punished.

item.title: Benjamina Ebuehi’s recipe for yoghurt panna cotta with banana and tahini crumble | The sweet spot
item.description: I’m of the opinion that we still need dessert in January.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to resent the thing I love’: Paul Mescal and Josh O’Connor on romance, rationing and retirement
item.description: All things considered, telling Paul Mescal I once placed a bet on him is not quite the icebreaker I had hoped.

item.title: The great debate about whether the NHS should use magic mushrooms to treat mental health
item.description: Larissa Hope truly believes that psilocybin, the active ingredient in magic mushrooms, saved her life.

item.title: Crowd chants 'tax the rich' as Zohran Mamdani sworn in as first Muslim mayor of New York
item.description: SBS acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country and their connections and continuous care for the skies, lands and waterways throughout Australia.

item.title: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact
item.description: The signs were evident early on in Usman Khawaja's career that he would do things his own way.

item.title: 'My greatest blessings': Khawaja's emotional retirement message
item.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja will retire after the fifth and final game of the Ashes series, marking his 88th Test.

item.title: Dakar Rally 2026 nears as Aussie champ Daniel Sanders eyes 'back-to-back' wins
item.description: SBS acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country and their connections and continuous care for the skies, lands and waterways throughout Australia.

item.title: The perfect way to beat the slump: how to tackle mid-afternoon energy dips
item.description: It is an all-too-familiar scenario: you reheat a bowl of last night’s noodles for lunch, devour it, then return to your desk and gradually droop over the course of the afternoon, to the point at which you are battling to keep your eyes open.

item.title: The Bright Side by Sumit Paul-Choudhury review – a hymn to positivity
item.description: Can optimism influence events in your life? Does fate smile upon those who see the glass as half full? The science writer Sumit Paul-Choudhury believes so.

item.title: My rookie era: nobody sounds good when they first play a violin
item.description: I knew the violin was an unforgiving instrument but I had always wanted to play it.

item.title: They tried to smear him as an antisemite – but Mayor Zohran Mamdani walks in a rich Jewish tradition | Molly Crabapple
item.description: Billionaires raised fortunes against him.

item.title: January isn’t for reinvention – it’s for dishes we know by heart
item.description: Our friend Bridget is serious about Christmas, and she does it spectacularly: come 1 December, her tree will be up, beautifully lit and decorated, her nearest and dearest (us included, thankfully) will get their bespoke Advent calendar (this year it was a cheesy one for me and a puzzle for Sarit – perfect) and a month of fun activities will ensue, culminating in a magnificent day.

item.title: Film Technica: Our top picks for the best films of 2025
item.description: Streamers made a strong showing this year, as did horror.

item.title: Dry Cleaning: Secret Love review | Alexis Petridis's album of the week
item.description: Dry Cleaning’s third album features a lot of strikingly odd lyrics.

item.title: Veganuary can be a piece of cake: cooks and dieticians share 12 ways to make delicious plant-based food
item.description: This new year, you may be embarking on Veganuary, or have resolved to eat less meat and dairy in 2026.

item.title: The perfect day for parents: how to keep kids healthy and happy – without neglecting yourself
item.description: Sometimes, though, it feels impossible to sort the must-dos from the nice-to-dos, the good from the good enough.

item.title: How to make your strength building goals and stick to them in the new year
item.description: Is building strength your New Year's resolution? Here's how to assess strength, come up with goals, start an effective bodyweight routine and stick with it.

item.title: Sir David Attenborough explores the surprising wildlife of London
item.description: Sir David Attenborough explores the surprising wildlife of his hometown – London.

item.title: The best pictures from around the world as 2026 begins
item.description: The island of Kiritimati - an atoll in the remote Pacific nation of Kiribati - was the first place to enter 2026.

item.title: Zelensky says peace deal is 90% ready in New Year address
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said a peace agreement to end the war with Russia is "90% ready", in a New Year address that largely focused on resistance to Moscow's full-scale invasion.

item.title: World is in better place than when Eden Project created 25 years ago, founder says
item.description: Sir Tim Smit says the world is in a better place than it was when he co-founded the Eden Project 25 years ago and he believes people are more attuned to the natural world.

item.title: What’s the best path to take in 2026? | Fiona Katauskas
item.description: It depends which direction you takeSee more of Fiona Katauskas’s cartoons here Continue reading.

item.title: The perfect night out: how to ditch the telly – and have next-level fun
item.description: ‘It’s nice to have a night out that doesn’t revolve around drinking,” says the person next to me as we put the finishing touches to our lino prints of pomegranates, wintry trees, the anime character Totoro (mine) and a martini-drinking cat, which we’ve spent our Friday evenings crafting.

item.title: Watch: Stunning celestial events that lit up the skies in 2025
item.description: From meteor showers to supermoons, many stunning celestial events have been captured on camera over the past year.

item.title: The best cross trainers for a low-impact workout at home, tested
item.description: A quick admission: I absolutely love an elliptical or cross trainer.

item.title: Swashbuckling Puss embarks on a brave quest
item.description: Puss must beat a host of fairy-tale characters to the magical map of the Wishing Star.

item.title: 'I am so happy': Crowd celebrates Thailand's release of Cambodian soldiers
item.description: Thailand has released 18 Cambodian soldiers held since fighting between the two nations broke out in July.

item.title: Some of the best TV in years is to come
item.description: It looks like 2026 could give us some of the best TV in years, although with scheduling plans often only being made public weeks before transmission, it's impossible to know whether some shows will actually go on air in the coming year, or in 2027.

item.title: 'I've had wonderful support from women', says incoming Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: "One of the wonderful things over the last couple of months is I've had hundreds and hundreds of letters of support," says the incoming Archbishop of Canterbury.

item.title: Heated Rivalry author says TV success led to help with her Parkinson's
item.description: The author of Heated Rivalry has revealed the success of the TV adaptation has resulted in her receiving specialist help with her Parkinson's disease.

item.title: The best photos of 2025, taken by Guardian Australia photographers – video
item.description: From schoolies to floods, Guardian Australia was there to photograph every moment.

item.title: Dear Life review – Brooke Satchwell hauntingly good in an otherwise clunky drama
item.description: In Stan’s new six-part drama, Brooke Satchwell delivers a painfully good performance as Lillian, a distraught widow whose centre of gravity – entire footing in the universe, in fact – has been thrown off by the death of her fiance.

item.title: The WHO learned to love ‘anti-obesity’ jabs in 2025. I don’t fully agree, but I get it | Devi Sridhar
item.description: If there has been a hot topic in health in 2025, it’s definitely been GLP-1s, colloquially referred to as “anti-obesity” jabs.

item.title: The perfect evening routine: how to prepare for bed – from blue light to baths
item.description: After a hard day at work, the last thing you want to do is fritter away your precious downtime slumped on the sofa in a dazed doomscroll.

item.title: The perfect lunch break: how to get away from your desk – and seize the day
item.description: I confess that I find this idea a bit uninspiring.

item.title: The 10 best vehicles Ars Technica drove in 2025
item.description: Of all the cars we’ve driven and reviewed this year, these are our picks.

item.title: Rukmini Iyer’s quick and easy party platters: halloumi with pineapple salsa and za’atar carrots with labneh | Quick and easy
item.description: This hot halloumi platter is such a crowdpleaser that it’s worth making with two blocks of halloumi, even for a smaller group.

item.title: 'It's amazing' - Torvill and Dean recognised in New Year Honours
item.description: Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean have been recognised for their voluntary work, in the New Year's Honours list.

item.title: 'I can finally breathe easy despite rare condition'
item.description: For a long time, everyday tasks like climbing the stairs or doing the washing left Natalie Rekowski breathless.

item.title: Great white sharks face extinction in Mediterranean, say researchers
item.description: Great white sharks in the Mediterranean Sea are in danger of disappearing, with illegal fishing contributing to their decline.

item.title: Kids’ own adventures: 25 free school holiday activities around Australia this summer
item.description: Need a quick low-cost summer school holiday activity? There are heaps of free workshops, performances and exhibitions all around Australia, with many operating drop-in sessions – a busy parent’s dream.

item.title: ChatGPT, cooking and Christopher Walken: how parents got their kids to love reading in 2025
item.description: It’s been a tough year for our brains.

item.title: The secrets of a great sex life: how to keep the flame alive in the bedroom
item.description: If you have sex, chances are, you’ll have a good day.

item.title: Arc Raiders review – pure multiplayer pleasure
item.description: Arc Raiders is an extraction shooter from Embark Studios – so, a game where you deploy into a map full of other players and do as much shooting and looting as you can before making an escape.

item.title: Georgina Hayden’s quick and easy recipe for pimento cheese and pickle loaded crisps | Quick and easy
item.description: Pimento cheese, a much-loved American spread, has been a permanent fixture in my kitchen this month.

item.title: Why 2026 looks bright for Northern Light sightings
item.description: In 2026, there is a good chance that the vivid purples, reds and greens of the Northern Lights will be visible in skies across the UK.

item.title: Could AI relationships actually be good for us?
item.description: There is much anxiety these days about the dangers of human-AI relationships.

item.title: The perfect morning routine: how to build a happy, healthy start to the day – from showers to sunshine
item.description: The first thing to say about the ideal morning routine is that it probably doesn’t exist.

item.title: In the ’90s, Wing Commander: Privateer made me realize what kind of games I love
item.description: Most things Privateer did have been done better, but it’s still a classic.

item.title: Conservative and Christian? US right champions psychedelic drugs
item.description: For half a century, psychedelics largely belonged to the cultural left: anti-war, anti-capitalist, suspicious of the church and state.

item.title: Helen Goh’s recipe for an espresso martini pavlova bar | The sweet spot
item.description: Your favourite cocktail is now a DIY pavlova party! Pile crisp coffee meringues high with espresso cream, boozy cherries, a drizzle of whisky caramel and a flicker of edible gold leaf, then shake, spoon and sparkle your way into the New Year.

item.title: Julia Donaldson's joyful tale of love
item.description: Two devoted scarecrows plan the perfect wedding – until a rival threatens everything.

item.title: Wild animals are great gift givers – and there’s one present in particular I’d love to receive for Christmas | Helen Pilcher
item.description: This Christmas morning, are you worried you didn’t choose quite the right gift for that someone special? I always try my hardest, but everywhere I turn I’m bombarded with unhelpful suggestions.

item.description: The bill would significantly curtail scope of the federal environmental review process.

item.description: Christmas markets are not just tradition across Europe, they are big businesses that give cities a huge economic boost every December.
